Def.Name: Laurel Willow
Def.Description: Shrub or small tree. Grows in wet, boggy ground and may grow to 50' tall.
Def.Leaves: Simple, alternate, very fine toothed magins. 1.5" - 5" long and 13/16" - 1 15/16" wide. Shiny, dark green ontop, lighter green on bottom. May have a pleasant smell when crushed.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Capsule, containing many seeds, surrounded by white fluff. Male catkins are yellow and female are green.
Def.Bark: Light gray, smooth with shallow vertical furrows that are widely spaced.
Def.Range: Hardy to zone 3a. Native to Northern Europe and Northern Asia.
Def.Remarks: Very glossy leaves make it an attractive ornamental tree. May be found in parks and yards.
